nodes.name: Circle
nodes.description: Renders a perfect Circle center in the view port.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: Clip-space radius.

parameters.name: T
parameters.description: Interpolation factor between full white cirle (0.) and height of the hemisphere (1.).

nodes.name: Transform
nodes.description: Transform every source texel using the translation, rotation, scale.

parameters.name: translate
parameters.description: 2D vector translation.

parameters.name: scale
parameters.description: 2D vector scale.

parameters.name: rotation
parameters.description: Angle in degrees. Center of rotation is the center of the source.

nodes.name: Checker
nodes.description: Renders a 4 square black and white checker. Use a Transform node to scale it to any number of squares.

nodes.name: Sine
nodes.description: Renders a one directioned sine as a greyscale value.

parameters.name: translation
parameters.description: Translate the sine to adjust its start and end.

parameters.name: frequency
parameters.description: Basically, the number of bars.

parameters.name: angle
parameters.description: Angle in degrees of the so called bars.

nodes.name: SmoothStep
nodes.description: Performs a smoothstep operation. Hermite interpolation between 0 and 1 when Low < x < high. This is useful in cases where a threshold function with a smooth transition is desired.

parameters.name: low
parameters.description: Lower value for the Hermite interpolation.

parameters.name: high
parameters.description: Higher value for the Hermite interpolation. Result is undertimined when high value < low value.

nodes.name: Blur
nodes.description: Performs a Directional of Box blur filter. Directional blur is a gaussian pass with 16 pixels. Box is 16x16.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Selection of the Blur type.

parameters.name: angle
parameters.description: angle in degrees for the directional blur.

parameters.name: strength
parameters.description: Defines how wide the blur pass will be. The bigger, the larger area each pixel will cover.

parameters.name: passCount
parameters.description: Multiple passes are supported by this node.

nodes.name: NormalMap
nodes.description: Computes a normal map using the Red component of the source as the height.

parameters.name: spread
parameters.description: The bigger, the stronger the resulting normal will be.

parameters.name: invert
parameters.description: Change the direction of the XY components of the normal.

nodes.name: LambertMaterial
nodes.description: simental node.

nodes.name: MADD
nodes.description: For each source texel, multiply and and a color value.

parameters.name: mulColor
parameters.description: The color to multiply the source with.

parameters.name: addColor
parameters.description: The color to add to the source.

nodes.name: Blend
nodes.description: Blends to source together using a built-in operation. Each source can also be masked and multiplied by a value.

parameters.name: A
parameters.description: Color/mask to multiply A source with.

parameters.name: B
parameters.description: Color/mask to multiply A source with.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.description: Built-ins operation used for blending. Check the examples below.

nodes.name: Invert
nodes.description: Performs a simple color inversion for each component. Basically, for R source value, outputs 1.0 - R.

nodes.name: CircleSplatter
nodes.description: Renders a bunch of circle with interpolated position and scales. For N circles the interpolation coefficient will be between [0/N....N/N].

parameters.name: distance
parameters.description: First and Last value to interpolate between for the distance to the center of the viewport.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: First and Last value for the interpolated circle radius.

parameters.name: angle
parameters.description: First and Last value for the Angle. The circle position is computed using the angle and the distance.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The total number of circles to render.

nodes.name: Ramp
nodes.description: Performs a Ramp on the source components. For each source value (X coord on the ramp graph), retrieve an intensity value (Y on the ramp graph). Optionnaly use an image instead of the editable graph.

parameters.name: ramp
parameters.description: Graph that can be edited.

nodes.name: Tile
nodes.description: Generate a tile map of the source image. With optional overlap. An optional Color input can be used to modulate the tiles color. Color is uniform per tile and picked at its center in the output image.

parameters.name: translation
parameters.description: Translate the noise seeds so you can have virtualy infinite different noise.

parameters.name: quincunx
parameters.description: Offset line and/or column.

parameters.name: noiseFactor
parameters.description: position noise factor. A value of 0 means the grid cells are more tightly packed and with less size variation.

parameters.name: rotationFactor
parameters.description: Rotate sprite randomly. This factor limits the rotation amount.

parameters.name: scale
parameters.description: How many cells used per dimension.

parameters.name: innerScale
parameters.description: Sprite uniform scale.

nodes.name: Color
nodes.description: Single plain color.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: Single plain color.

nodes.name: NormalMapBlending
nodes.description: Blend two normal maps into a single one. Choose the Technique that gives the best result.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Different techniques for blending. Check the examples below to see the differences.

nodes.name: Voronoi
nodes.description: Generate noise based on work by Inigo Quilez.

parameters.name: translation
parameters.description: Translate the noise seeds so you can have virtualy infinite different noise.

parameters.name: noise
parameters.description: Interpolate between centered seed (checker) to jittered random position.

parameters.name: colorInterpolation
parameters.description: Interpolation factor between full color to distance-like color per cell.

parameters.name: distanceBlend
parameters.description: Distance computation type interpolate between Euclydean distance (0.) and Manhattan Distance (1.)

nodes.name: WorleyNoise
nodes.description: Generate Worley noise with optional Manhattan distance.

parameters.name: translation
parameters.description: Translate the noise seeds so you can have virtualy infinite different noise.

parameters.name: manhattan
parameters.description: Mahattan or linear distance.

parameters.name: translation
parameters.description: Translate the noise seeds so you can have virtualy infinite different noise.

parameters.name: octaves
parameters.description: The number of noise with different scale for each.

parameters.name: lacunarity
parameters.description: Geoemtric scale applied for each octave.

parameters.name: gain
parameters.description: Intensity factor applied to each octave.

nodes.name: PBR
nodes.description: Experimental Node.

nodes.name: PolarCoords
nodes.description: Transform the source using polar coordinates.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Change to direction of the transformation.

nodes.name: Clamp
nodes.description: Performs a clamp for each component of the source. Basically, sets the min and max of each component.

parameters.name: minimum
parameters.description: The minimal value for each source component.

parameters.name: maximum
parameters.description: The maximal value for each source component.

nodes.name: ImageRead
nodes.description: Imports a file from the disk. Major formats are supported. Cubemaps can be imported using one image for each face of using a cubemap .DDS/.KTX. MP4 movies can be read as well.

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: Single image frame or DDS/KTX cubemap.

parameters.name: XPosFilename
parameters.description: Cubemap image face for +X direction.

parameters.name: XNegFilename
parameters.description: Cubemap image face for -X direction.

parameters.name: YPosFilename
parameters.description: Cubemap image face for +Y direction (Top).

parameters.name: YNegFilename
parameters.description: Cubemap image face for -Y direction (Bottom).

parameters.name: ZPosFilename
parameters.description: Cubemap image face for +Z direction.

parameters.name: ZNegFilename
parameters.description: Cubemap image face for -Z direction.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.enum: Free|Keep ratio on Y|Keep ratio on X|Same as source|

nodes.name: Thumbnail
nodes.description: Create a thumbnail picture from the source input and applies it to the thumbnail library view.

parameters.name: make
parameters.description: Force the evaluation without building the graph.

nodes.name: Paint2D
nodes.description: Paint in the parameter viewport using the connected brush. Paint picture is saved in the graph.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Size of the output in pixels.

nodes.name: Swirl
nodes.description: Performs a rotation on source based on distance to the viewport center.

parameters.name: angles
parameters.description: Rotation for the inner pixels (closer to the center) and the outter pixels. Angles in degrees.

nodes.name: Crop
nodes.description: Set the output as a rectangle in the source.

parameters.name: quad
parameters.description: X/Y Position and width/height of the selection rectangle.

nodes.name: PhysicalSky
nodes.description: Generate a physical sky cubemap.

parameters.name: ambient
parameters.description: Ambient aka minimal color within the cubemap. Ambient alpha is used to modulate it with the sky.

parameters.name: lightdir
parameters.description: Light direction vector.

parameters.name: Kr
parameters.description: Kr component value.

parameters.name: rayleighBrightness
parameters.description: Rayleigh brightness

parameters.name: mieBrightness
parameters.description: Mie brightness factor.

parameters.name: spotBrightness
parameters.description: Spot/sun brightness.

parameters.name: scatterStrength
parameters.description: Scatter strength.

parameters.name: rayleighStrength
parameters.description: Rayleigh strength.

parameters.name: mieStrength
parameters.description: Mie strength.

parameters.name: rayleighCollectionPower
parameters.description: Rayleigh collection power.

parameters.name: mieCollectionPower
parameters.description: Mie collection power.

parameters.name: mieDistribution
parameters.description: Mie distribution.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Size of the cubemap face width in pixels.

nodes.name: CubemapView
nodes.description: Used to display a cubemap using various techniques.

parameters.name: view
parameters.description: Used by the Camera technique to rotate the eye direction.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Techniques for display. See below for examples.

parameters.name: LOD
parameters.description: Use a particular LOD (mipmap) for display. Radiance cube node can help produce cubemap mipmaps.

nodes.name: EquirectConverter
nodes.description: Converts an equirect source (one single picture containing all environment) into a cubemap output. The inverse (cubemap -> equirect) can also be performed with this node.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Select to operation to perform.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Size fo the ouput in pixels.

nodes.name: NGon
nodes.description: Compute N plans and color the texels behind every plan accordingly. Texels in front of any plan will be black.

parameters.name: sides
parameters.description: Number of uniformly distributed plans.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: Distance from the plan to the center of the viewport.

parameters.name: T
parameters.description: Interpolation factor between full white color and distance to the nearest plan.

parameters.name: startAngle
parameters.description: Angle in degrees of the first vertex.

nodes.name: GradientBuilder
nodes.description: Computes a linear gradient based on key values(position/color).

parameters.name: gradient
parameters.description: Double click to add a click. Click and drag a key to move it position. Modify the color for the selected key.

nodes.name: Warp
nodes.description: Displace each source texel using the Warp input.

parameters.name: strength
parameters.description: How strong is the displacement. Clip-space value.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: One of 2 modes. XY offset : R and G channels are used for X and Y displacement. Rotation-Distance: R is used as an angle (0..1 -> 0..2pi) and G is the length of the displacement.

nodes.name: AO
nodes.description: Compute ambient occlusion based on an input heightmap.

parameters.name: strength
parameters.description: Strength of the occlusion. The higher value, the stronger dark you'll get.

parameters.name: area
parameters.description: Area size used to compute the AO. The higher value, the bigger area.

parameters.name: falloff
parameters.description: How much each sample influence the AO.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: Radius in clipspace used for the computation.

nodes.name: SVG
nodes.description: Import an SVG vector graphics image and rasterize it to an image output.

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: Relative or absolute filepath of the SVG file.

parameters.name: dpi
parameters.description: Resolution used for rendering the SVG. The higher value, the bigger the image will be.

nodes.name: EdgeDetect
nodes.description: Performs an edge detection on the source. Texels that are close in intensity with the neighbours will be white. Black if the difference is strong.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: The radius size in clipspace used for detection. The higher value, the broader the search is.

nodes.name: Kaleidoscope
nodes.description: Duplicates portion of the source using rotation and symetry. Basically, computes N plans and duplicate what's in front of the plane to the other with or without symetry.

parameters.name: center
parameters.description: Center of the operation in clipspace coordinates [0..1]

parameters.name: startAngle
parameters.description: Angle in degrees of the first plan. Total sum of plan angle is 360 deg.

parameters.name: splits
parameters.description: How many split plans to use.

parameters.name: symetry
parameters.description: Enable symetry for even plans.

nodes.name: Palette
nodes.description: Find the closest color inside the predefined palette for each texel in the source. Using optional dithering.

parameters.name: palette
parameters.description: Predefined palette. Check examples below for results.

parameters.name: ditherStrength
parameters.description: Bayer dithering strength (0 = none, 1 = full dither).

nodes.name: ReactionDiffusion
nodes.description: Use multipass to compute a Reaction Diffusion generative synthesis from a source image. Pass count must be a multiple of 3. First 2 passes are used to blur the image.

parameters.name: boost
parameters.description: Component boost

parameters.name: divisor
parameters.description: Reaction divisor.

parameters.name: colorStep
parameters.description: Component color step.

parameters.name: passCount
parameters.description: Multiple passes are supported by this node.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Size of the output in pixels

nodes.name: Disolve
nodes.description: Apply a fluid dynamic-like process on the source image. A noise is computed and is used to displace the source.

parameters.name: passCount
parameters.description: Multiple passes are supported by this node.

parameters.name: frequency
parameters.description: Noise frequency. The higher, the more noise you'll get.

parameters.name: strength
parameters.description: Noise strength.

parameters.name: randomization
parameters.description: How much randomization is applied.

parameters.name: verticalShift
parameters.description: How much in clip-space is moved to the top. Somekind of force applied to texels.
